for_final_project

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • for_final_project.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Database
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A Database object is a graphical user interface for uploading name and birthday information into a database.
    Author:
    Kristin Jones
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database()
        Creates a Database by constructing all graphical user interface and back end components, and adding front end components to the content pane.

    • Method Detail

      • constructAllGUIComponents

        private void constructAllGUIComponents()
        A method to construct all labels, buttons, text fields and text areas of the GUI. Uses the utility methods of class UtilityMethods.

      • stepsForLoad

        private void stepsForLoad()
        The method called when the Load button is pressed. Calls the loadFromFile method in class BirthInfoCollection.

      • stepsForSave

        private void stepsForSave()
        The method called when the Save button is pressed. Calls the saveFromFile method in the BirthInfoCollection class.

      • stepsForOK

        private void stepsForOK()
        The method called when the user hits the OK button to signal it is ok to save BirthInfos to a file. Calls the saveToFile method from the class BirthInfoCollection.

      • stepsForCancelLoad

        private void stepsForCancelLoad()
        The method called when the user hits the Cancel button to signal it is not ok to load BirthInfos into a file.

      • stepsForChronDisplay

        private void stepsForChronDisplay()
        The method called when the user hits the Chronological Sort Display button. Calls the chronological toString method from the BirthInfoCollection class.

      • convertMonthToInt

        private int convertMonthToInt(java.lang.String theMonth)
        A utility method that converts the string format of month, given in the dropdown menu facing the user, to an int that can be processed by the BirthDate class.
        Parameters:
        theMonth - The string representation that must be turned into an int
        Returns:
        Returns an int representing the number of the month.

      • stepsForAdd

        private void stepsForAdd()
        The method called when the user hits the add button. Adds a new BirthInfo to the database.

      • stepsForAlpha

        private void stepsForAlpha()
        The method called when the user hits the Alphabetical Sort and Display button. Calls the alphabetical toString method from the BirthInfoCollection class.

      • stepsForDelete

        private void stepsForDelete()
        The method called when the user hits the Delete button. Prompts the user to enter name information correctly, if needed, and to confirm the intent to delete the record.

      • stepsForConfirmDelete

        private void stepsForConfirmDelete()
        The method that is called when the user confirms intent to delete a record. Calls the delete method in the class BirthInfoCollection.

      • stepsForCancelDelete

        private void stepsForCancelDelete()
        The method called when the user hits the Cancel button. Sets textfields to empty text and does not proceed to actual deletion of record.

      • stepsForSearch

        private void stepsForSearch()
        The method called when the user hits the search button. Searches for the record in the collection using the BirthInfo's name value only. Calls the search method from the class BirthInfoCollection.

      • adjustButtons

        private void adjustButtons(boolean tFValue)
        A utility method to set buttons to enabled or disabled, as desired, upon opening of application.
        Parameters:
        tFValue - The boolean value that will change the enabled setting of the button

      • reset

        private void reset()
        A utility method that calls the adjustButtons method of this class with the parameter true.

      • clearInputFields

        private void clearInputFields()
        A utility method to clear all input fields. Sets text to empty string.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method of the Database class. Constructs an instance of the Database class, and makes the close button in fact close the program.
